IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: NED HAS A SINGLE MISSION - ADVANCING DEMOCRACY IN THE WORLD. OUR TARGETED, DEMAND-DRIVEN SMALL GRANTS PROGRAM RESPONDS TO THE NEEDS OF LOCAL NGOS THAT DEFEND HUMAN RIGHTS, STRENGTHEN INDEPENDENT MEDIA AND CIVIC EDUCATION, AND EMPOWER WOMEN AND YOUTH IN A MANNER THAT ENABLES THEM TO ESTABLISH CREDIBILITY AS DEMOCRATIZING FORCES IN THEIR OWN SOCIETIES. NED FURTHER LEVERAGES ITS GRANTS PROGRAM THROUGH NETWORKING AND RECOGNITION ACTIVITIES THAT PROVIDE POLITICAL SUPPORT AND SOLIDARITY (THE WORLD MOVEMENT FOR DEMOCRACY, THE CENTER FOR INTERNATIONAL MEDIA ASSISTANCE, THE REAGAN-FASCELL DEMOCRACY FELLOWS PROGRAM, AND DEMOCRACY AWARD EVENTS), AS WELL AS THROUGH SCHOLARLY RESEARCH THAT GIVES ACTIVISTS ACCESS TO THE LATEST INSIGHTS ON STRENGTHENING LIBERAL VALUES AND DEVELOPING STRATEGIES FOR DEMOCRATIC TRANSITION (THE JOURNAL OF DEMOCRACY AND THE INTERNATIONAL FORUM FOR DEMOCRATIC STUDIES).
IRS990.MissionDescription: NED HAS A SINGLE MISSION - ADVANCING DEMOCRACY IN THE WORLD. OUR TARGETED, DEMAND-DRIVEN SMALL GRANTS PROGRAM RESPONDS TO THE NEEDS OF LOCAL NGOS THAT DEFEND HUMAN RIGHTS, STRENGTHEN INDEPENDENT MEDIA AND CIVIC EDUCATION, AND EMPOWER WOMEN AND YOUTH IN A MANNER THAT ENABLES THEM TO ESTABLISH CREDIBILITY AS DEMOCRATIZING FORCES IN THEIR OWN SOCIETIES. NED FURTHER LEVERAGES ITS GRANTS PROGRAM THROUGH NETWORKING AND RECOGNITION ACTIVITIES THAT PROVIDE POLITICAL SUPPORT AND SOLIDARITY (THE WORLD MOVEMENT FOR DEMOCRACY, THE CENTER FOR INTERNATIONAL MEDIA ASSISTANCE, THE REAGAN-FASCELL DEMOCRACY FELLOWS PROGRAM, AND DEMOCRACY AWARD EVENTS), AS WELL AS THROUGH SCHOLARLY RESEARCH THAT GIVES ACTIVISTS ACCESS TO THE LATEST INSIGHTS ON STRENGTHENING LIBERAL VALUES AND DEVELOPING STRATEGIES FOR DEMOCRATIC TRANSITION (THE JOURNAL OF DEMOCRACY AND THE INTERNATIONAL FORUM FOR DEMOCRATIC STUDIES).
IRS990.Description: DEMOCRATIC GOVERNANCE AND POLITICAL PARTIES - THE ENDOWMENT SEEKS TO PROMOTE STRONG STABLE POLITICAL PARTIES COMMITTED TO THE DEMOCRATIC PROCESS.

Activity2.Description: EDUCATION, CULTURE AND COMMUNICATION - THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS PROGRAMS THAT NOURISH A STRONG DEMOCRATIC CIVIC CULTURE. SUPPORT IS PROVIDED FOR CIVIC EDUCATION, TRAINING PROGRAMS, PUBLICATIONS AND OTHER COMMUNICATION MEDIA.

Activity3.Description: PLURALISM - THE ENDOWMENT ENCOURAGES THE DEVELOPMENT OF STRONG INDEPENDENT PRIVATE SECTOR INSTITUTIONS SUCH AS TRADE UNIONS, BUSINESS ASSOCIATIONS, CIVIC AND WOMEN'S ORGANIZATIONS.

Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: DEPUTY TO THE PRESIDENT FOR STRATEGY & POLICY
VP PLANNING, GRANTS MGT, COMPLIANCE & EVAL

Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.Explanation: THE ENDOWMENT IS GENERALLY EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IN ADDITION, THE ENDOWMENT QUALIFIES FOR CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS DEDUCTIONS AND HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. INCOME WHICH IS NOT RELATED TO EXEMPT PURPOSES, LESS APPLICABLE DEDUCTIONS, IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL AND STATE CORPORATE INCOME TAXES. THERE WAS NO NET TAX LIABILITY FOR UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX FOR THE YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2013. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE ENDOWMENT'S TAX POSITIONS AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE ENDOWMENT HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE DISCLOSURE. THE ENDOWMENT FILES TAX RETURNS IN THE U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTIONS. GENERALLY, THE ENDOWMENT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL OR STATE AND LOCAL INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2010.

Form990ScheduleFPartV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS OUTSIDE THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleFPartV.Explanation: SCHEDULE F, PART I, LINE 2: THE NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY MAINTAINS A COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE THE ACCOUNTABILITY OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS PROVIDED TO GRANTEES BOTH IN THE U.S. AND AROUND THE WORLD. THE COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT IMPLEMENTS AN AUDIT STRATEGY THAT BEGINS WITH THE REQUIRED COMPLETION AND SUBMISSION BY GRANTEES OF A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL QUESTIONNAIRE, WHICH IS USED BY THE COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT, IN PART, TO DEVELOP RISK ASSESSMENTS AND THEN TO FORMULATE SPECIFIC AUDIT MONITORING PROCEDURES FOR INDIVIDUAL GRANTEES. AUDIT MONITORING PROCEDURES INCLUDE INVOICE VERIFICATION REVIEWS, DAILY TRANSACTION LEDGER REVIEWS, DESK REVIEWS, MAINTAINING AUDIT LOGS, REVIEW OF A-133 AND OTHER GRANTEE AUDIT REPORTS, CONDUCTING ON-SITE FINANCIAL REVIEWS, AND ENGAGING INDEPENDENT PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS TO PERFORM AUDIT PROCEDURES FOR CERTAIN GRANTEES. APPROPRIATE FOLLOW-UP PROCEDURES, INCLUDING REVIEW OF CORRECTIVE ACTION PLANS, ARE PERFORMED AS PART OF THE OVERALL AUDIT STRATEGY.

SCHEDULE F, PART IV, LINE 6: AT THIS TIME IT IS UNCLEAR IF THE ORGANIZATION IS REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 5713, HOWEVER, THE FORM HAS BEEN FILED UNDER SEPARATE COVER WITH THE IRS. THE ORGANIZATION WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS REQUIREMENT. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE FORM 990-T.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY MAINTAINS A COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE THE ACCOUNTABILITY OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS PROVIDED TO GRANTEES BOTH IN THE U.S. AND AROUND THE WORLD. THE COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT IMPLEMENTS AN AUDIT STRATEGY THAT BEGINS WITH THE REQUIRED COMPLETION AND SUBMISSION BY GRANTEES OF A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL QUESTIONNAIRE, WHICH IS USED BY THE COMPLIANCE DEPARTMENT, IN PART, TO DEVELOP RISK ASSESSMENTS AND THEN TO FORMULATE SPECIFIC AUDIT MONITORING PROCEDURES FOR INDIVIDUAL GRANTEES. AUDIT MONITORING PROCEDURES INCLUDE INVOICE VERIFICATION REVIEWS, DAILY TRANSACTION LEDGER REVIEWS, DESK REVIEWS, MAINTAINING AUDIT LOGS, REVIEW OF A-133 AND OTHER GRANTEE AUDIT REPORTS, CONDUCTING ON-SITE FINANCIAL REVIEWS, AND ENGAGING INDEPENDENT PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS TO PERFORM AUDIT PROCEDURES FOR CERTAIN GRANTEES. APPROPRIATE FOLLOW-UP PROCEDURES, INCLUDING REVIEW OF CORRECTIVE ACTION PLANS, ARE PERFORMED AS PART OF THE OVERALL AUDIT STRATEGY.

Form990ScheduleJPartII.Title: DEPUTY TO THE PRESIDENT FOR STRATEGY

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE BUDGET & AUDIT COMMITTEE, THE PRESIDENT, THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER, AND THE SENIOR DIRECTOR OF FINANCE. IT IS ALSO REVIEWED BY THE BOARD BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DIRECTORS AND INDIVIDUALS EMPLOYED ARE REQUIRED TO AFFIRM THEIR COMPLIANCE WITH THE NED'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY COMPLETING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST CERTIFICATION FORM WHEN FIRST JOINING THE BOARD OR FIRST EMPLOYED AND ON AN ANNUAL BASIS THEREAFTER.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL SALARIES FOR NED EMPLOYEES MUST BE COMMENSURATE WITH NED POLICY ESTABLISHED BY ITS BOARD OF DIRECTOR'S SALARIES AND PROCEDURES FOR SALARY ADJUSTMENTS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BUDGET AND AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ANNUALLY. AS PART OF THE COMMITTEE'S REVIEW OF THE ENDOWMENT'S ADMINISTRATIVE BUDGET, SPECIFIC SALARY ADJUSTMENTS FOR INDIVIDUAL EMPLOYEES ARE RECOMMENDED BY THEIR IMMEDIATE SUPERVISORS, DEPENDENT ON THE MERIT AND/OR NEW RESPONSIBILITIES. THE COMPENSATION FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BY THE BUDGET & AUDIT COMMITTEE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE SAME ORGANIZATIONAL PROCEDURES, AND THE ENDOWMENT USES THE SERVICES OF AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT AS WELL AS PUBLISHED COMPENSATION SURVEYS IN MAKING THIS DETERMINATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT GENERALLY MAKE AVAILABLE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC, BUT WILL MAKE SUCH INFORMATION AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ANNUAL AUDIT IS PRESENTED BY THE AUDITORS TO THE BUDGET & AUDIT COMMITTEE TO DISCUSS THE RESULTS OF THE ANNUAL AUDIT AND ANY FINDINGS. THE BUDGET & AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND ACCEPTS THE ANNUAL AUDIT AND RECOMMENDS TO THE BOARD FOR THEIR APPROVAL.
